Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.

co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: measurements were conducted with a CHI660C workstation.The light source was an LED monochromatic point lamp (3 W, 420 nm).The light spot effective area on the working electrode was set as 2cm 2 and 0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 aqueous solution was used as the electrolyte.The open circuit voltages were set as the initial bias voltages in the transient photocurrent responses tests. The experiments were performed in a sealed quartz bottle containing 2.5 mg of catalyst dispersed in 3 mL of acetonitrile and 2 mL of water

as counter electrodes and a AgAgClsaturated KCl (aq) electrode as reference electrode.The working electrode was prepared on fluorine-doped tin oxide (ITO, 2 cm 2 cm) glass, cleaned by sonication in acetone and ethanol for 30 min, and then dried.The ITO slide was dip-coated with 0.55 mL of slurry, which was obtained from the mixture of photocatalyst (1 mg), ethanol (0.5 mL) and Nafion solution (0.05 mL, 5 ww in water and 1propanol) under sonication for 30 min.The photocurrent measurements were conducted

the CO 2 .At the same time, no CO evolution was detected when using water or trimethylamine as sacrificial electron donor.In addition, the apparent quantum efficiency (AQE) for CO evolution was measured to be 0.036 for PD-COF-23 and 0.079 for PD-COF-23-Ni.It's known that the efficient charge separation and transfer play an important role in aqueous photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.The conduction band (CB) edge of the photocatalysts should be more negative than the CO 2 reduction potential (COCO 2 ,

process and catalytic reaction mechanisms.The highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) mainly distributes along the electron donating TAPP fragment, while lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) locates on DPP segments.The sufficient electron density separation of HOMO and LUMO energy levels enable the electron transfer from TAPP to DPP fragments upon visible light irradiation (Fig. 4a).One possible reaction route was proposed for the photocatalytic reaction based on PD-COF-23-Ni.As shown in Fig. 4b,

quenching cycle, first absorb visible light to form the excited NiTAPP, then associate with TEOA to form MTAPP -, lastly, reduce CO 2 into CO at Ni(II) centers.In this case, TEOA plays an important role as the sacrificial electron donor to prevent the charge recombination on the porphyrin fragments and achieve a complete photocatalytic cycle.As a result, the Ni(II) incorporated PD-COF-23-Ni shows a higher activity than PD-COF-23 in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.

acetonitrile and 2 mL of water with 0.5 mL of TEOA as a sacrificial regent.Then, the mixture was purged with CO 2 for 10 min and then sealed at 1 atm CO 2 .A 300 W Xe lamp (Zhong Jiao Jin Yuan, Model CEL-HXF300) was used as the light source.After irradiation, the released gas (400 L) was collected by syringe from the headspace of the reactor and analyzed by gas chromatography (Shimadzu, GC-2014, Japan, with ultrapure Ar as a carrier gas) equipped with a TDX-01(5 A molecular sieve column) and a flame
